header.rec_loc: Campervan journey from Tarnow to Białka Tatrzańska, Poland – part 2.
header.topics: Living with hippies in Poland, the trip to Białka Tatrzańska, friends, physical characteristics, religion, health & exercise, friends.
header.activity: Two friends talking about various topics (see 9 above) while driving in a campervan from Tarnow to Białka Tatrzańska, Poland – part 2.

speaker.occupation: unemployed/ Some part-time private TEFL teacher/ Semi-retired
Teacher of English as a foreign Language

aha
yeah but anyway so yeah ah not too much further up here then you turn right
aha
and then is a bit like where we were
aha
with the other day just like erm it's got a smallish
smallish place
yeah a small square in the middle with parking all around a few shops you know? the butcher the baker the candlestick maker all around in a square and that's it
mm mm
and otherwise it's just sort of a thoroughfare for other places
yeah

and is quite similar to that and then for the you branch off and go another I don't know ten fifteen minutes up on a lot of single track windy roads and you end up it's about a thousand metres above sea level so hopefully you won't be too hot in the summer erm and it's stunning
sounds nice
absolutely stunning and then the bit that I'll be staying in will be like a little log cabin and you've got an orchard behind you where you can see woodpeckers even in September October
mm

still see woodpeckers saw erm the great spotted saw a male and a female and I saw a green woodpecker and they have jays and they have all sorts of cute little birds as well thirteen cats I think something like six dogs
do they have wi-fi?
they don't have wi-fi
unless you're near the main house
aha
so you can go to the main house and get wi-fi and then in theory the log cabin has an Ethernet cable but I took my computer one time and plugged it in and didn't work so
oh okay

and then erm it's got a little wood burner which is why I'm not living there now erm so yeah I think April time is or May time is sufficient it's got a wood burner and that's the only heating er water is alright the shower has a boiler where you don't touch a thing don't change the temperature do nothing and you should get warm water
right erm that's funny

yeah it is and then you sort of look out there's like a bit of a clearing and they've got horses and cows and ducks and hens and they sort of are in the clearing bit and then you've got some more trees and then over the top of the trees where the sun rises you get this beautiful view of
nice
and you've got all the jaggedy mountains that look really sort of red and orange with the sunrise and it's just beautiful
very nice

just because I mean to get you know warmth in my bones my feet especially

ah well I've had the heating on

ah okay you can't change it someway so do you just have a timer?
it's it's not on a timer
ah
but it's a little bit it's either too sensitive or not sensitive at all in that it's either on really hot

you'd roast?

yeah

and yeah I thi I think just that volume of glass makes it really really cold and so I just take a hot water bottle up and have two blankets wear a fleece and when I get up for my first middle of the night wee I take my fleece off and I'm fine for the rest of the night sometimes kick a blanket off
yeah no quite snug

good I don't mind taking the floor tonight by the way seeing as erm I'm probably more used to it I've got a couple of foam things in like the top here that I can put on the floor and then I've got the double sleeping bag that lives in the van then my double duvet and two blankets so I can kind of make a bit of a camp bed thing of sleeping on stuff

erm and then stuff on the top so I don't mind
no I don't mind doing that
and then I gather then there are just three single beds for three single people but I didn't really like the idea of four people spreading out on three beds pushed together

little bit close not that I don't like you all cos of course I do but you know?
no I'm the same I just can't sleep with other people around
